revision.text:
{{Infobox artist discography | Artist = [[Goldfinger (band)|Goldfinger]] | Image = Goldfinger_live.jpg | Caption = Goldfinger live in [[Philadelphia]] in 2008 | Studio = 7 | Live = 3 | EP = 4 | Singles = 17 | Video = | Music videos = 16 }} The following is the discography of [[Goldfinger (band)|Goldfinger]], a Los Angeles-based [[punk rock]] band formed in 1994 by [[John Feldmann]] on vocals and guitar, Simon Williams on bass, former drummer of Buffalo NY's Zero Tolerance Darrin Pfeiffer on drums, and Charlie Paulson on guitar. The band released six [[studio albums]] between 1996 and 2008, as well as three [[live album]]s, a [[compilation album]], four [[extended play]]s, seventeen [[single (music)|singles]], and sixteen [[music video]]s. The band released their [[Goldfinger (album)|self-titled debut album]] in 1996, which featured their biggest hit, "[[Here in Your Bedroom]]", which reached number five on the U.S. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'s}} [[Hot Modern Rock Tracks]] chart, and within the top 15 on ''[[RPM (magazine)|RPM]]''{{'s}} [[Canadian rock/alternative chart|Alternative 30]] in Canada. Their second album, ''[[Hang-Ups]]'' (1997), represented their biggest chart position on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] at number 85, and featured the song "Superman", which became well-known for its appearance in the video game ''[[Tony Hawk's Pro Skater]]'' (1999). Their next album, ''[[Stomping Ground]]'' (2000), featured a cover of [[Nena (band)|Nena]]s' "[[99 Red Balloons]]", which was licensed on a number of movie soundtracks. Subsequent albums—''[[Open Your Eyes (Goldfinger album)|Open Your Eyes]]'' (2002), ''[[Disconnection Notice]]'' (2005), and ''[[Hello Destiny...]]'' (2008)—did not fare as well, and the band has ceased recording music, instead becoming an occasional touring act.{{cite news|title=Catching Up with Goldfinger: "Superman" John Feldmann Spills All|date=June 29, 2015|author=Maria Sherman|url=http://www.fuse.tv/2015/06/goldfinger-john-feldmann-interview|publisher=[[Fuse (TV channel)|Fuse]]|accessdate=March 16, 2016}} ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" |+ List of studio albums, with selected chart positions, sales figures and certifications ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Year ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Album details ! scope="col" colspan="3" | Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Sales ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] |- ! scope="col" style="width:2em;font-size:90%;" | [[Billboard 200|US]]
